1.content:
Have you ever wished you could trade your old, boring life for a brand new one? That was the question posited by the numerous advertisements for a company called New Horizons. The company had been around for just over a year; some Silicon Valley startup. I’d never it to my family, but I sometimes found myself looking at the site; tempted to click on the button to set up a free consult.

Before you get the wrong idea, I love my family very much; my mom (Abigail) is great and my twin sister (Kelsey) is great too. But ever since I turned 13, I’ve found my life to be rather boring.

I suppose it might have something to do with the fact that I’m not very popular at school; my only two friends being Kyle Williams and David Beltran. The three of us were a popular target for the bullies, and members of the popular clique, at school.

Maybe one of these days, I’ll finally have the courage to click on that button…
1.title: Prologue

11.content:
Today started like any other Saturday morning; I woke up at 7:45 to the smell of bacon and sausage coming from the kitchen downstairs. Getting out of bed, I trudged downstairs to find that Kelsey and Mom were sitting at the kitchen table.

The looks they were giving me, as I took a seat at the table, were rather off-putting. It was like they had something they wanted to tell me, but couldn’t figure out how to do it. After a few moments of them looking at me like that, I finally relented and said, “Why are you guys looking at me like that?”

Mom and Kelsey turned to face each other; after getting a nod of approval from Kelsey, Mom turned to me and said, “It’s no secret that you’re unhappy with your life, Kevin; you feel like you’re meant to be somewhere else.” Getting up, Mom grabbed an envelope from the counter and handed it to me. “Your sister and I feel this might boost your spirits a little bit.”

Opening the envelope, I pulled out a pamphlet and other items from New Horizons. Shocked, I looked at Mom and said, “What’s this?”

“I think you know what it is, sweetie.” Looking sad, Mom said, “This is your chance to create a better, happier life for yourself.”

Knowing what I did about the company, I was genuinely surprised that Mom and Kelsey would do this. “I appreciate the gesture, guys; but I-I can’t do this.” Looking at them both, I said, “If I go through with this; chances are that I’ll never see you again.”

“Just knowing that you’ll be happy will be enough for me.” Embracing me, Mom said, “If nothing else, you can always email us.”

There was no way I could ever properly thank Mom and Kelsey for what they were doing for me. Despite the risk involved, that I’d probably ever see them again, they were willing to make the necessary sacrifice to ensure that I was happy.

With tears coming down my face, I got up and hugged them. “Thank you guys, y-you have no idea how much this means to me.” Looking at them, I said, “But are you okay with the thought of never seeing me again?”

“You haven’t been happy for a long time, Kevin; that’s pretty obvious.” Smiling, tears coming down her face, Kelsey said, “If doing this means you’ll finally have a chance at happiness, then we’d be crazy not to go through with it.”

“You have an appointment at their local office at noon; which should give you plenty of time to tie up any loose ends.” Wiping tears from her eyes, Mom said, “I’m going to miss you so much, Kevin.”

“Thanks, mom.” Pausing, I said, “I-I’m going to get dressed; then I’ll go talk with Kyle and David.”
11.title: The Beginning

info.brief_description: Kevin Scott is unhappy with his life; until his mom and sister decide to help him.
info.description:
Kevin Scott is a 15-year-old boy; he lives at home with his mom and sister. Kevin is an unhappy teenager, often imagining what it would be like to lead another life. One day his mom and sister give him a gift to do just that - a reservation with New Horizons; a company that specializes in giving people the life they've always dreamed of. There is, however, a catch; if Kevin goes through with this, there's a chance he'll never see his family again.
